title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: The picture which recals the old edifice most dis tinctly to my mind, is the one in Arnot s History of Edinburgh.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: But it is remarhable thatWilliam Lyon was merely banished from Scotland; while aquack named Makke, by whom the pretended poison, ormagical preparation vvas made up, escaped with the loss ofhis ears.—See Pinkerton, Tytler, Lesley, Arnot, A-c. __c.

title: A Tour in Tartan-Land
author: Bede, Cuthbert
snippet: Arnot, in his' History of Edinburgh,' represents ' the usurper Macbeth ' to have made donations to the cruciform churchthat bad risen on the site of the Culdee's timber-cell;but the Macbeth here mentioned was probably Macbeth,Bishop of Ross.
